content.description:
Panama Geisha ascends an overhung nose via compression movement over a good landing.

Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand sidepull. From there, pull up further to a left hand on overhang, bump the right hand to a jug, walk the feet over and place a right heel hook, make a move to a right hand bump-edge on the nose, hold tight, place a left heel hook, bump the left hand up the arete, make big, awkward right hand move to a jug, work the arete and feet into place, and gain the great foot. At this point, either adventure up the chossy remainder or just jump back down.
content.protection: Two or three pads. The landing is flat and clear though.
content.location: It climbs the north facing nose of Geisha.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, ascend the face using the left hand sidepull feature and right hand edges to reach an immediate mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Geisha, just to the south of the tree.
